[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Messaging and Monitoring System (MMS) defines requirements for an asynchronous communication platform ensuring scalability, security, and efficiency.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MMS supports message processing, monitoring, error tracking, audit logging, and platform independence.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MMS integrates with CSR, Data Stream, and messaging services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MMS provides a GUI-based monitoring and reporting portal for administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MMS operates on AWS and hybrid infrastructures using Docker and Kubernetes.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MMS utilizes REST APIs with FastAPI for backend, React.js for frontend, PostgreSQL for structured data, and Kafka for real-time messaging.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MMS ensures secure asynchronous messaging and encrypted data transmission.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: MMS optimizes transaction handling with dynamic load balancing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: MMS supports 24/7 availability with bi-annual updates and quarterly maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: MMS enables multi-threading, fault tolerance, and auto-scaling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: MMS links to authentication, audit logging, and compliance monitoring.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MMS facilitates real-time message processing, error tracking, audit logging, and performance monitoring.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: MMS is designed for system administrators, DBAs, and IT support teams.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: MMS requires real-time data synchronization, secured transmission, and high-availability infrastructure.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MMS relies on external messaging services, encryption protocols, and WS-Security compliance.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Asynchronous Messaging: Message exchange without immediate response.
Load Balancing: Distributes traffic across servers for efficiency.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall enable real-time message exchange between CSR and Data Stream services.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide REST API integration for monitoring and audit logging.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall support asynchronous messaging, load balancing, and process messages within 2 seconds, polling every second (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall notify users of message failures and retries (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall store transaction logs for at least one year for auditing (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive GUI with role-based dashboards and real-time alerts.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process and deliver 99% of messages within 2 seconds under peak loads.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store transaction logs, audit records, and error-tracking data.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with the City of Chicago Application Development Guide Framework.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall follow WS-Security encryption and data integrity standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure 99.99% uptime with automated failover mechanisms and redundancy.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Message processing, security, and GUI monitoring shall be tested.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: System documentation, monitoring dashboards, security policies, and audit reports.
[SEC] 5. References: Industry best practices for message processing, encryption, and fault tolerance.
